Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with top of cul; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of goat (underbelly, part of hind legs and part of forelegs remaining) to right; rising roundel, rising lozenge and rosettes as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 251, no. 386, pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0139) (phase 2)
